doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/1H25 in line strong ThermalWind offset weak HydroPV Cut FY RE ins target1H25 in line strong ThermalWind offset weak Hydr_2025-08-29

passages.text: China (PRC) | Electric Utilities China Power
1H25 in line; strong Thamal/Windoffset weak Hydro/PV; Cut FY RE ins target

China power reported 1H25 Rev/NP of RMB23,858/2,835mn (vs. RMB26,472/2,802mn in 1H24). Thermal/wind power seg PAT was up by \(29 / 8.4\%\) YoY, benefiting from coal cost reduction/capacity addition + better wind resource; offset weak Hydro/PV. In view of IRR uncertainty ahead due to notice 136, Co cut 2H RE ins target to 1.5GW (vs previous FY25 RE ins target of c.7GW and actual in of 4.5GW in 1H25). We cut our PT to HKD3.66/sh in view of the declining power tariff.

1H25 in line, strong Thermal/Wind offset weak Hydro/PV. China Power reported 1H25 Rev/ NP of RMB23,858/2,835mn (vs. RMB26,472/2,802mn in 1H24). Thermal power seg PAT improved by \(29\%\) YoY to RMB1,428mn, primarily with unit fuel cost decreased by \(14\%\) YoY to RMB234.52/MWh in 1H25, despite coal-fired tariff decreased by RMB19/MWh YoY to RMB373/MWh, with higher RE electricity mix resulting in lower spot tariff. Wind power seg reported PAT of RMB2,124mn, up \(8.4\%\) YoY, which was mainly driven by the growth in power gen from capacity addition+better wind resource, amid wind tariff down RMB36/MWh YoY to RMB411/MWh. Solar power tariff also saw YoY decline of RMB24/MWh to RMB377/MWh in 1H25, with higher mix of solar projects with grid- parity tariff and the implementation of mkt- based trading policy. Utilization hours dropped by 73h YoY to 665h, on weaker sunshine resource. Thus, seg PAT dropped by \(37\%\) YoY to RMB716mn. With less rainfall than 1H24, utilization hours of hydro- power in 1H25 declined by 434h YoY to 1,387h, resulting in power sales to drop by \(23\%\) YoY. Seg PAT fell by \(28\%\) YoY to RMB550mn.

Cut FY25 RE installation target; Guide annual RE capacity addition of 10GW dur 15th FYP. In 1H25, China power added c.1.6/2.9GW of wind/solar power capacity. In view of IRR uncertainty raised by notice 136, mgmt cut annual RE installation target by c.1GW to 6GW, implying c.1.5GW (Wind/Solar power of c.0.6/0.9GW) of RE capacity to be added in 2H25. Mgmt expects annual RE installation to stay high at c.10GW during 15th FYP, co expects and will add certain thermal power capacity as well to support the intermittent RE installation. Considering annual RE in of c.5- 10GW in 14th FYP and IRR deterioration post the implementation of notice 136, we see annual RE installation of 10GW during 15th FYP might imply further asset injection from SPIC.
Curtailment rate raised in 1H. Mgmy guided blended curtailment rate of RE in 1H25 increased by 5.4pct to \(10\%\) (10.6% for wind power, up 6.1pct; 10.47% for solar power, up 4.7pct).

JEF View We update 2025/26/27E NP to RMB4,005/4,096/5,255mn and update PT to RMB3.6/sh, by applying 0.54x FY25E PB for thermal power and 6.5x FY25E PE for renewables, considering potential risk in declining power tariffs while dividend yield remains robust.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 4-9 of this report. \\* Jefferies Hong Kong Limited

China Power, incorporated in 2004, is a subsidiary of State Power Investment Corporation (SPIC). It is an integrated energy group that covers hydropower, wind power, PV power, coal- fired power, natural gas power, environmental power, and energy storage. It has a clear target to transform from a traditional power generation enterprise into a green and low- carbon energy provider. China Power is positioned as the only flagship clean energy listed subsidiary of SPIC and have the support from the group. According to the arrangement with the SPIC Group, China Power has preferential rights to acquire assets from the group, except for those in Shanghai.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
We apply \(0.54x\) FY25E PB for thermal power and \(6.5x\) FY25E PE for renewables to arrive at our PT of HKD3.66/sh.
Upside Scenario, HK\$4.392000926, \(+40\%\)
For our bull- case scenario, we apply \(0.65x\) FY25E PB/7.8x FY25E PE. This gives us a PT of HKD4.39/sh.
Downside Scenario, HK\$1.8300003858, \(- 42\%\)
For our bear- case scenario, we apply \(0.27x\) FY25E PB/3.25x FY25E PE. This gives us a PT of HKD1.83/sh.

Top Material Issue(s): GHG Emissions. Thermal power accounts for the majority of power generation of the company. During the process of combustion in the coal- fired unit boiler, power plants generate exhaust gases including carbon dioxide, sulphur dioxide, nitrogen oxides and soot. China Power actively responds to emission reduction requirements of the government and improved carbon emissions management. Water & Wastewater Management. Wastewater is generated during the process of electricity production, e.g. the concentration of steam turbine circulating cooling water, coal field flush and sanitary sewage etc.
Potential A- share listing, further asset injection from group

1. Onshore installed capacity of clean energy to account for \(90\% /95\%\) by 2025/2030  
2. Become the world's leading green and low-carbon energy provider by 2035

1. What is the margin effect of utilizing more sustainable inputs?  
2. Has the company set up a target for emissions?  
3. What are the long-term targets for company's total emissions & energy usage?
China PowerChina Power International Development Limited, through its subsidiaries, develops, constructs, owns, manages, and operates large power plants in China.

We apply SOTP valuation to determine our base- case PT is HKD3.66, which includes 1) thermal power: \(0.54x\) FY25EPB, 2) renewables: \(6.5x\) FY25EPE. Risks include insufficient coal supply, higher- than- expected coal price, and slower- than- expected installation pace.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed
Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period.
Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period.

Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk,

growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
